attributes.action: Sexual education should not be tolerated in primary school teachings
attributes.background: In my sons primary school they’re talking about puberty and sex. They show them rude pictures of boys privates along with the girls now even putting them in a different room?

rejection.details:
We understand you are concerned about sex education in primary schools. However, sex education is not compulsory in primary, and parents are entitled to withdraw their children from sex education lessons in schools which choose to teach it, so we're not sure what it is you'd like the Government to do differently.

You can read guidance for primary schools on the teaching of sex education here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/relationships-education-relationships-and-sex-education-rse-and-health-education/relationships-education-primary#sex-education-primary.
